subject: Critical Thinking
title: Modus Tollens: Reasoning Backward
description: One-minute skill: Modus Tollens: Reasoning Backward.

hook.text: If it rained, the street would be wet. The street is dry. Therefore it didn't rain. Equally flawless.

buildup.text: Modus tollens: If P then Q. Q is false. Therefore P is false. It's deduction in reverse.

discovery.text: Scientists use this constantly: if my theory is true, X should happen. X didn't happen. Theory is wrong.

twist.text: Karl Popper built his entire philosophy of science on modus tollens ‚Äî falsification over confirmation.

climax.text: You can never prove a theory true, but modus tollens lets you prove one false with a single observation.

punchline.text: One black swan disproves 'all swans are white.'

quiz.question: What does modus tollens allow you to conclude?
options: If Q is true, P must be true
If Q is false, P must be false
If P is false, Q is false
